title: upgrade commons-io due to CVE-2021-29425
body:
# Description

Upgrade commons-io to 2.8.0, it's a vulnerability in FileNameUtils.normalize that isn't used in this project.

More information about the vulnerability can be found here: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-556

I have run the tests locally (which failed to to unrelated javadoc warnings) and done a basic check in my application that uses github-api, but not done any other testing.

title: Move to using assertThat() exclusively
body:
# Description
The `assertThat()` style of assertions is more verbose but also more expressive.  The matchers provide a clear and consistent structure for describing actual and expected results. 

This change replaces all other `assert*` methods in the library with `assertThat(...)` methods and enforces the exclusive use of `assertThat()` verifications. 

# Before submitting a PR:
We love getting PRs, but we hate asking people for the same basic changes every time.

- [x] Push your changes to a branch other than `main`. Create your PR from that branch.
- [x] Add JavaDocs and other comments
- [x] Write tests that run and pass in CI. See [CONTRIBUTING.md](CONTRIBUTING.md) for details on how to capture snapshot data.
- [x] Run `mvn -D enable-ci clean install site` locally. If this command doesn't succeed, your change will not pass CI.

# When creating a PR: 

- [ ] Fill in the "Description" above.
- [ ] Enable "Allow edits from maintainers".

title: Switch to 'main' as default branch
body:
# Description 
Switching to "main" as the default branch. 

# Before submitting a PR:
We love getting PRs, but we hate asking people for the same basic changes every time. 

- [ ] Push your changes to a branch other than `master`. Create your PR from that branch.    
- [ ] Add JavaDocs and other comments
- [ ] Write tests that run and pass in CI. See [CONTRIBUTING.md](CONTRIBUTING.md) for details on how to capture snapshot data.
- [ ] Run `mvn -D enable-ci clean install site` locally. If this command doesn't succeed, your change will not pass CI. 

# When creating a PR: 

- [ ] Fill in the "Description" above. 
- [ ] Enable "Allow edits from maintainers".

title: Chore(deps-dev): Bump archunit from 0.17.0 to 0.18.0

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: java
labels.description: Pull requests that update Java code

body:
[//]: # (dependabot-start) Ð²Ñ™Â Ð¿Ñ‘Ð **Dependabot is rebasing this PR** Ð²Ñ™Â Ð¿Ñ‘Ð If you make any changes to it yourself then they will take precedence over the rebase. --- [//]: # (dependabot-end) Bumps [archunit](https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit) from 0.17.0 to 0.18.0.
Release notes

Sourced from archunit's releases.

ArchUnit 0.18.0

Breaking Changes

  • JavaClass.get{All}Interfaces() is now JavaClass.get{All}RawInterfaces() to be consistent with regards to the generic JavaClass.getInterfaces(). We decided that this is still a less painful way than deprecating getInterfaces(), introducting a new getGenericInterfaces(), then deprecate getGenericInterfaces() in favor of getInterfaces() in a later release. To be consistent with other places in ArchUnit JavaClass.getInterfaces() needs to provide the generic version of the interfaces (compare e.g. JavaClass.getSuperclass()).

Enhancements

Core

  • Support for Java Records (see #295; thanks a lot to @Ð²Ð‚â€¹rweisleder)
  • JavaClass now knows its generic interfaces (retrievable via JavaClass.getInterfaces()). Furthermore type arguments of generic interfaces are now part of the JavaClass.directDependencies{From/To}Self (see #551)

Lang

  • New syntax methods classes().that().containAny{Members,Fields,Methods,...}That(..) (see #553; thanks a lot to @Ð²Ð‚â€¹nils-christian)

Library

  • Added an API to calculate Software Architecture Metrics inspired by John Lakos, Robert C. Martin and Herbert Dowalil. For further details check the user guide (see #572; thanks a lot to @Ð²Ð‚â€¹hankem and @Ð²Ð‚â€¹stefanhechtltng and to @Ð²Ð‚â€¹hdowalil for the inspiration and support)

Further Acknowledgement

  • Thanks a lot to @Ð²Ð‚â€¹rweisleder and @Ð²Ð‚â€¹Strohgelaender for improving the documentation
Commits
  • 165c695 adjust expected POMs to upgraded dependencies
  • 4e0b214 prepare release 0.18.0
  • 389d876 Add software architecture metrics #572
  • 772dc98 extend user guide for software architecture metrics
  • c8ec061 add Visibility Metrics by Herbert Dowalil
  • e8ac8df add Component Dependency Metrics by Robert C. Martin
  • e5aaa68 add Lakos software architecture metrics
  • 36d83dc Upgrade some dependencies #571
  • 011cada Bump kramdown from 2.3.0 to 2.3.1 in /docs
  • d9ae7cc Bump asciidoctorj-diagram from 2.1.0 to 2.1.2

title: GHRepository#listLanguages incorrect return type
body:
**Describe the bug**
GHRepository#listLanguages 's return type is defined Map<String, Long>, but actual object is Map<String, Integer>

**To Reproduce**
run code with:
 final Map<String, Long> languageMap = ghRepository.listLanguages();
and in the debugger, inspect the actual object.
Later step, if we use the value, we get java.lang.ClassCastException: class java.lang.Integer cannot be cast to class java.lang.Long

**Expected behavior**
Either
- The method has signature: public Map<String, Integer> listLanguages() , OR
- the return object match to the actual signature

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: MacOS10.15.7
 - Browser: chrome(not related)
 - Version: org.kohsuke:github-api:1.127

**Additional context**
Please see screenshot
![Screen Shot 2021-04-15 at 11 38 42 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43150831/114983063-05aba880-9e45-11eb-8939-90cb14054108.png)

title: NullPointerException calling GHCheckRun.update() then .create()
body:
**Describe the bug**

using org.kohsuke:github-api:1.127 to match version available in recent Jenkins release

Calling GHCheckRun.update() and subsequently GHCheckRunBuilder.create() where GHCheckRun was obtained through GHRepository.getCheckRuns() causes a NullPointerException. 

GHRepository GHObject is null and not being set in this scenario

```
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.kohsuke.github.GHCheckRunBuilder.<init>(GHCheckRunBuilder.java:75)
	at org.kohsuke.github.GHCheckRun.update(GHCheckRun.java:339)
	at org.kohsuke.github.GHCheckRun$update.call(Unknown Source)
	at org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.callsite.CallSiteArray.defaultCall(CallSiteArray.java:47)
	at org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.callsite.AbstractCallSite.call(AbstractCallSite.java:116)
	at org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.callsite.AbstractCallSite.call(AbstractCallSite.java:120)
```

Official tests show this working only if you call .update() and .create() ONLY IF you have the original reference to the created GHCheckRun https://github.com/hub4j/github-api/pull/980/commits/bde6ad9a06cc71db3d0b8b187bfab5f889175b5c

**To Reproduce**
(roughly)

```groovy
def repository = gh.getRepository(repo)
def checkRun = repository.getCheckRuns(sha).first()
def checkBuilder = checkRun.update()
.... update something ....
def checkUpdated = checkBuilder.create()
```

**Expected behavior**

I should be able to update a GHCheckRun that was queried through the GHRepository

**Workaround**

Manually setup a GHCheckRunBuilder passing in the GHRepository object

```groovy
def repository = gh.getRepository(repo)
def checkRun = repository.getCheckRuns(sha).first()
def checkBuilder = new GHCheckRunBuilder(repository, checkRun.id)
.... update something ....
def checkUpdated = checkBuilder.create()
```

title: GHRelease.uploadAsset tries uploading to github.com for GHE repo
body:
**Describe the bug**
I have a groovy script that gets a repo, creates a release, and then uploads assets to the release. It works for github.com but when I try to point at a private GHE instance the upload falls back to github.com. The repo is found, the release is created, the uploadUrl returned [here](https://github.com/hub4j/github-api/blob/884248930e7c6c025693d4b453c06cd3e0a058be/src/main/java/org/kohsuke/github/GHRelease.java#L172) is `https://github.***.com/api/uploads/repos/***/***/releases/659238/assets{?name,label}` which looks correct, but when the upload is attempted [here](https://github.com/hub4j/github-api/blob/884248930e7c6c025693d4b453c06cd3e0a058be/src/main/java/org/kohsuke/github/GHRelease.java#L249) it fails.

```
Exception in thread "main" org.kohsuke.github.HttpException: {"message":"Bad credentials","request_id":"BD4F:30ED:54248:84035:6065E067","documentation_url":"https://docs.github.com/rest"}
	at org.kohsuke.github.Requester.handleApiError(Requester.java:703)
	at org.kohsuke.github.Requester._to(Requester.java:306)
	at org.kohsuke.github.Requester.to(Requester.java:247)
	at org.kohsuke.github.GHRelease.uploadAsset(GHRelease.java:144)
	at org.kohsuke.github.GHRelease.uploadAsset(GHRelease.java:131)
	at net.adoptopenjdk.release.UploadAdoptReleaseFiles$_uploadFiles_closure3.doCall(UploadFiles.groovy:100)
	at net.adoptopenjdk.release.UploadAdoptReleaseFiles$_uploadFiles_closure3.call(UploadFiles.groovy)
	at org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.DefaultGroovyMethods.each(DefaultGroovyMethods.java:2296)
	at org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.DefaultGroovyMethods.each(DefaultGroovyMethods.java:2281)
	at org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.DefaultGroovyMethods.each(DefaultGroovyMethods.java:2322)
	at net.adoptopenjdk.release.UploadAdoptReleaseFiles.uploadFiles(UploadFiles.groovy:87)
	at net.adoptopenjdk.release.UploadAdoptReleaseFiles.access$0(UploadFiles.groovy)
	at net.adoptopenjdk.release.UploadAdoptReleaseFiles$_release_closure2.doCall(UploadFiles.groovy:43)
	at net.adoptopenjdk.release.UploadAdoptReleaseFiles$_release_closure2.call(UploadFiles.groovy)
	at org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.DefaultGroovyMethods.callClosureForMapEntry(DefaultGroovyMethods.java:5929)
	at org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.DefaultGroovyMethods.each(DefaultGroovyMethods.java:2373)
	at net.adoptopenjdk.release.UploadAdoptReleaseFiles.release(UploadFiles.groovy:36)
	at net.adoptopenjdk.release.UploadAdoptReleaseFiles$release.call(Unknown Source)
	at org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.callsite.CallSiteArray.defaultCall(CallSiteArray.java:47)
	at org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.callsite.AbstractCallSite.call(AbstractCallSite.java:115)
	at org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.callsite.AbstractCallSite.call(AbstractCallSite.java:119)
	at net.adoptopenjdk.release.UploadFiles.run(UploadFiles.groovy:127)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	at org.codehaus.groovy.reflection.CachedMethod.invoke(CachedMethod.java:101)
	at groovy.lang.MetaMethod.doMethodInvoke(MetaMethod.java:323)
	at groovy.lang.MetaClassImpl.invokeMethod(MetaClassImpl.java:1217)
	at groovy.lang.MetaClassImpl.invokeMethod(MetaClassImpl.java:1041)
	at org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.InvokerHelper.invokePogoMethod(InvokerHelper.java:1011)
	at org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.InvokerHelper.invokeMethod(InvokerHelper.java:994)
	at org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.InvokerHelper.runScript(InvokerHelper.java:423)
	at org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.InvokerHelper$runScript.call(Unknown Source)
	at org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.callsite.CallSiteArray.defaultCall(CallSiteArray.java:47)
	at org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.callsite.AbstractCallSite.call(AbstractCallSite.java:115)
	at org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.callsite.AbstractCallSite.call(AbstractCallSite.java:135)
	at net.adoptopenjdk.release.UploadFiles.main(UploadFiles.groovy)
Caused by: org.kohsuke.github.HttpException: Server returned HTTP response code: 401, message: 'Unauthorized' for URL: https://uploads.github.com/repos/***/***/releases/659238/assets?name=***.tar.gz
```

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Using GitHub Enterprise Server 2.21.14

**Expected behavior**
Url should be the one returned by getUploadUrl

title: Streamline GHEvent parsing from GHEventInfo.type
body:
GHEventInfo.type uses Pascal-case names with "Event" on the end instead of snake-case names used elsewhere in the API.  `getType()` does a bunch of processing every time it parses `type` into a `GHEvent`.  We should clean this up.
https://github.com/hub4j/github-api/pull/1096/files#r613635046

title: Add SCHEDULE to GHEvent and add UNKNOWN handling to GHEvent
body:
`SCHEDULE` is a valid event for scheduled workflow runs.

Also make `GHEvent` parsing more permissive as per our discussion from the previous weeks.

title: Log 202 message at the FINE level
body:
Also reintroduce the special case we had before as the info is
important.

@bitwiseman you removed the special cases to improve code coverage but I don't think it's a good idea.

For me, either we keep the logs and make them informative or we remove the log altogether given 202 is a success. It's just that the operation takes time.

In the case of cancel, I dropped the log as really you just want to cancel the thing, you don't really care that it will take time.

title: Search results do not return all results
Ignore ObsoleteUrlFactory for code coverage
body:
# Description 
Ignore ObsoleteUrlFactory

# Before submitting a PR:
We love getting PRs, but we hate asking people for the same basic changes every time. 

- [ ] Push your changes to a branch other than `master`. Create your PR from that branch.    
- [ ] Add JavaDocs and other comments
- [ ] Write tests that run and pass in CI. See [CONTRIBUTING.md](CONTRIBUTING.md) for details on how to capture snapshot data.
- [ ] Run `mvn -D enable-ci clean install site` locally. If this command doesn't succeed, your change will not pass CI. 

# When creating a PR: 

- [ ] Fill in the "Description" above. 
- [ ] Enable "Allow edits from maintainers".

title: Properly wrap the check runs with the repository when listing them
body:
Otherwise you have a not so nice NPE when trying to update them:
```
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.kohsuke.github.GHCheckRunBuilder.<init>(GHCheckRunBuilder.java:75)
	at org.kohsuke.github.GHCheckRun.update(GHCheckRun.java:339)
```

I added a basic test to check we are able to call the builder as that's the only problem I can foresee there.

title: Use codecov.io to report coverage
body:
# Description 
Use codecov.io to report coverage

# Before submitting a PR:
We love getting PRs, but we hate asking people for the same basic changes every time. 

- [ ] Push your changes to a branch other than `master`. Create your PR from that branch.    
- [ ] Add JavaDocs and other comments
- [ ] Write tests that run and pass in CI. See [CONTRIBUTING.md](CONTRIBUTING.md) for details on how to capture snapshot data.
- [ ] Run `mvn -D enable-ci clean install site` locally. If this command doesn't succeed, your change will not pass CI. 

# When creating a PR: 

- [ ] Fill in the "Description" above. 
- [ ] Enable "Allow edits from maintainers".
